Automatically add new messages to the li: Automatically add new messages to the list of our known messages when they are received.
Delete all objects of unconfigured messa: Delete all objects of unconfigured messages on adapter startup.
This ID is configured multiple times wit: This ID is configured multiple times with this data length
Name: Name
Optionally set a fixed data length for t: Optionally set a fixed data length for this message
Receive messages with the given ID: Receive messages with the given ID
Send messages with the given ID: Send messages with the given ID
Automatically send the message when some: Automatically send the message when some data part changed
Must be a 3 or 8 char hex ID: Must be a 3 or 8 char hex ID
Are you sure you want to remove this mes: Are you sure you want to remove this message? This will also remove all it's parsers. The message will be treated as unconfigured and may be deleted on adapter restart.
Data type in the can message: Data type in the can message
Bitmask to apply to detect/set a %s valu: Bitmask to apply to detect/set a %s value. If no bits are selected any byte value greater than 0 will be interpreted as %s.
This ID is reserved and can't be used: This ID is reserved and can't be used
There are some errors in you configurati: There are some errors in you configuration. Please check!
Script to read the value from the buffer: Script to read the value from the buffer. The buffer is available as %s and the value has to be written into %s.
Script to write the value to the buffer. The buffer is available as %s and the value as %s.
Your configuration is invalid. Please ch: Your configuration is invalid. Please check the settings marked in red.
Use the raw states, which are updated wi: Use the raw states, which are updated with every received or sent message and can be used to send your own messages. This enables the usage in scripts, but may lead to a higher load on systems with a high message throughput.
Add an additional Remote Transmission Re: Add an additional Remote Transmission Request (rtr) state on each message.
Using this import feature you are able t: Using this import feature you are able to import message configurations to extend your existing configuration.
You may use a predefined configuration f: You may use a predefined configuration from GitHub or upload a custom file.
Hint: All configurations are provided wi: Hint: All configurations are provided without any warranty! Depending on the connected system, sending incorrect messages may damage the system.
If not checked, an import will just add: If not checked, an import will just add new messages and parsers and those that have already been defined are ignored. An existing message or parser is determined by it's internal UUID and not the ID. If you want to reimport an exported file to update you configuration you have to set this option.
Using this export feature you are able t: Using this export feature you are able to export your message configurations.
The exported files can be shared or edit: The exported files can be shared or edited externally and reimported to update your configuration.
If checked, you can select the configure: If checked, you can select the configured messages you want to export. If not checked, all messages will be exported.
Author: Author
Ignore this error and try to import: Ignore this error and try to import
The downloaded index is not valid: The downloaded index is not valid
Message configuration copied. Use the pa: Message configuration copied. Use the paste button to paste this configuration to an other message.
Parser configuration copied. Use the pas: Parser configuration copied. Use the paste button to paste this configuration to an other parser.
Nothing to paste. Please use the copy bu: Nothing to paste. Please use the copy button first.
Setup a list of predefined state values: Setup a list of predefined state values
Comma separated list of real values and: Comma separated list of real values and display values. Example: 0=Off,1=On,2=Auto
Invalid format! Please use the format va: Invalid format! Please use the format value=text,value=text,…
Select a suitable role for the ioBroker: Select a suitable role for the ioBroker state or just use "state" if you are not sure.
Information about the state roles in ioB: Information about the state roles in ioBroker on GitHub
Set a certain value automatically in a g: Set a certain value automatically in a given interval
Interval in milliseconds to automaticall: Interval in milliseconds to automatically set the value
The value to set automatically in the gi: The value to set automatically in the given interval (%s)
Trigger the send action every time the v: Trigger the send action every time the value is set automatically
